page.title: 13ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Entertainment in the two villages is created by the villagers. In Binegar and Gurney Slade a lot of entertainment centres around the two public houses and The George, in particular, has its own skittles and darts team and will raise a team for most sports if the challenge is there. Clubs in the village include Brownies and Cubs for young people, the Womens Institute and a Welcome Club for the elderly. In Oakhill there is a cricket and football team, Cubs, Guides and Brownies. The Royal British Legion has both men and womens branches and there is a Good Companions Club for the elderly. There is also a youth club, an Oakhill branch of the Womens Institute, an Oakhill band and a well respected Choral Society. There is a parish council for both Ashwick and Binegar.
